resources.string: 30 Days Of Vocabulary
Day %1$d
adjective
noun
verb
Vivacious
Full of life and energy; lively.
She is a vivacious and happy person who lights up a room.
Satisfaction
The feeling of happiness when you get what you want or need.
His new car gave him great satisfaction.
Giggle
To laugh in a quiet or child-like way.
She was giggling because the joke made her laugh.
Captivate
To attract and hold the interest or attention of someone.
Her singing captivated the audience.
Witty
Someone who is witty is intelligent and can make funny remarks quickly.
He was witty and very charming.
Inventive
Being good at thinking of new ideas or making new things.
Her inventive approach to problem solving impressed her professors.
Determinant
Something that influences or causes a situation.
Your level of commitment will be a major determinant of your success.
Gallantry
Courageous behavior, especially in battle.
The soldier was awarded for his gallantry in the field.
Hope
To desire or wish for something to happen.
I hope to see you again.
Repose
A state of rest or relaxation.
After a long day at work, she sought repose in her comfortable bed.
Hospitality
The friendly and helpful behavior towards guests.
They showed great hospitality to their guests by providing delicious food and comfortable accommodation.
Elation
A feeling of extreme happiness or excitement.
Winning the lottery filled her with elation.
Pleasing
Giving enjoyment or satisfaction.
The music was very pleasing to the ears.
Stylish
Having a fashionable and attractive appearance or way of doing things.
She looked stylish in her new dress.
Gaiety
The state of being happy and excited, often in a social setting.
Everyone was in a state of gaiety during the holiday party.
Elegant
Beautiful and stylish in a way that seems graceful or sophisticated.
She wore an elegant dress to the party.
Vote
A formal expression of choice or decision, typically in an election or meeting.
Everyone has the right to vote in the election.
Dirty
Not clean.
I need to clean my dirty shoes.
Bottle
A container with a narrow neck to hold liquids.
He took a sip from his water bottle.
Private
Belonging to or for a single person or group and not for others to know or use.
This is my private diary, please don\'t read it.
Station
A place where trains stop for people to get on or off.
I\'ll meet you at the train station.
Modern
Of or related to the present or most recent times, not old.
She enjoys modern art more than classic art.
Reflect
To throw back heat, light or sound without absorbing it.
The mirror reflects the light.
Divide
To separate into parts or groups.
She divided the cake into eight pieces.
Exchange
To give something to someone and receive something in return.
I will exchange my apple for your orange.
Route
A way or path from one place to another.
We decided to take the scenic route to the beach.
Strategy
A planned way to do something to achieve a specific goal.
Her strategy to win the game was to score early.
Rush
Quick and often uncontrolled movement of people.
There was a mad rush for the exit when the fire alarm sounded.
Wrap
To cover something by placing material around it.
She wrapped the gift in colorful paper.
Cute
Attractive in a charming or endearing way.
She has a cute kitten.
